013package org.apache.juneau;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
016
017import java.util.*;
018import java.util.function.*;
019
020import org.apache.http.*;
021import org.apache.http.message.*;
022import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
026
027
028/**
029 * Describes a single media type used in content negotiation between an HTTP client and server, as described in
030 * Section 14.1 and 14.7 of RFC2616 (the HTTP/1.1 specification).
031 *
032 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
033 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauRestCommonBasics">juneau-rest-common Basics</a>
034 *    <li class='extlink'><a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html">Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1</a>
035 * </ul>
036 */
037@BeanIgnore
038public class MediaType implements Comparable<MediaType>  {
039
040   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
041   // Static
042   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
043
044   /** Represents an empty media type object. */
045   public static final MediaType EMPTY = new MediaType("/*");
046
047   private static final Cache<String,MediaType> CACHE = Cache.of(String.class, MediaType.class).build();
048
049   /** Reusable predefined media type */
050   @SuppressWarnings("javadoc")
051   public static final MediaType
052      CSV = of("text/csv"),
053      HTML = of("text/html"),
054      JSON = of("application/json"),
055      MSGPACK = of("octal/msgpack"),
056      PLAIN = of("text/plain"),
057      UON = of("text/uon"),
058      URLENCODING = of("application/x-www-form-urlencoded"),
059      XML = of("text/xml"),
060      XMLSOAP = of("text/xml+soap"),
061
062      RDF = of("text/xml+rdf"),
063      RDFABBREV = of("text/xml+rdf+abbrev"),
064      NTRIPLE = of("text/n-triple"),
065      TURTLE = of("text/turtle"),
066      N3 = of("text/n3")
067   ;
068
069   /**
070    * Returns the media type for the specified string.
071    * The same media type strings always return the same objects so that these objects
072    * can be compared for equality using '=='.
073    *
074    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
075    *    <li class='note'>
076    *       Spaces are replaced with <js>'+'</js> characters.
077    *       This gets around the issue where passing media type strings with <js>'+'</js> as HTTP GET parameters
078    *       get replaced with spaces by your browser.  Since spaces aren't supported by the spec, this
079    *       is doesn't break anything.
080    *    <li class='note'>
081    *       Anything including and following the <js>';'</js> character is ignored (e.g. <js>";charset=X"</js>).
082    * </ul>
083    *
084    * @param value
085    *    The media type string.
086    *    Will be lowercased.
087    *    Returns <jk>null</jk> if input is null or empty.
088    * @return A cached media type object.
089    */
090   public static MediaType of(String value) {
091      return value == null ? null : CACHE.get(value, ()->new MediaType(value));
092   }
093
094   /**
095    * Same as {@link #of(String)} but allows you to specify the parameters.
096    *
097    *
098    * @param value
099    *    The media type string.
100    *    Will be lowercased.
101    *    Returns <jk>null</jk> if input is null or empty.
102    * @param parameters The media type parameters.  If <jk>null</jk>, they're pulled from the media type string.
103    * @return A new media type object, cached if parameters were not specified.
104    */
105   public static MediaType of(String value, NameValuePair...parameters) {
106      if (parameters.length == 0)
107         return of(value);
108      return isEmpty(value) ? null : new MediaType(value, parameters);
109   }
110
111   /**
112    * Same as {@link #of(String)} but allows you to construct an array of <c>MediaTypes</c> from an
113    * array of strings.
114    *
115    * @param values
116    *    The media type strings.
117    * @return
118    *    An array of <c>MediaType</c> objects.
119    *    <br>Always the same length as the input string array.
120    */
121   public static MediaType[] ofAll(String...values) {
122      MediaType[] mt = new MediaType[values.length];
123      for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++)
124         mt[i] = of(values[i]);
125      return mt;
126   }
127
128   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
129   // Instance
130   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
131
132   private final String string;                          // The entire unparsed value.
133   private final String mediaType;                      // The "type/subtype" portion of the media type..
134   private final String type;                           // The media type (e.g. "text" for Accept, "utf-8" for Accept-Charset)
135   private final String subType;                        // The media sub-type (e.g. "json" for Accept, not used for Accept-Charset)
136   private final String[] subTypes;                     // The media sub-type (e.g. "json" for Accept, not used for Accept-Charset)
137   private final String[] subTypesSorted;               // Same as subTypes, but sorted so that it can be used for comparison.
138   private final boolean hasSubtypeMeta;                // The media subtype contains meta-character '*'.
139
140   private final NameValuePair[] parameters;            // The media type parameters (e.g. "text/html;level=1").  Does not include q!
141
142   /**
143    * Constructor.
144    *
145    * @param mt The media type string.
146    */
147   public MediaType(String mt) {
148      this(parse(mt));
149   }
150
151   /**
152    * Constructor.
153    *
154    * @param mt The media type string.
155    * @param parameters The media type parameters.  If <jk>null</jk>, they're pulled from the media type string.
156    */
157   public MediaType(String mt, NameValuePair[] parameters) {
158      this(parse(mt), parameters);
159   }
160
161   /**
162    * Constructor.
163    *
164    * @param e The parsed media type string.
165    */
166   public MediaType(HeaderElement e) {
167      this(e, null);
168   }
169
170   /**
171    * Constructor.
172    *
173    * @param e The parsed media type string.
174    * @param parameters Optional parameters.
175    */
176   public MediaType(HeaderElement e, NameValuePair[] parameters) {
177      mediaType = e.getName();
178
179      if (parameters == null) {
180         parameters = e.getParameters();
181         for (int i = 0; i < parameters.length; i++) {
182            if (parameters[i].getName().equals("q")) {
183               parameters = Arrays.copyOfRange(parameters, 0, i);
184               break;
185            }
186         }
187      }
188      for (int i = 0; i < parameters.length; i++)
189         parameters[i] = new BasicNameValuePair(parameters[i].getName(), parameters[i].getValue());
190      this.parameters = parameters;
191
192      String x = mediaType.replace(' ', '+');
193      int i = x.indexOf('/');
194      type = (i == -1 ? x : x.substring(0, i));
195      subType = (i == -1 ? "*" : x.substring(i+1));
196
197      subTypes = Utils.splita(subType, '+');
198      subTypesSorted = Arrays.copyOf(subTypes, subTypes.length);
199      Arrays.sort(this.subTypesSorted);
200      hasSubtypeMeta = ArrayUtils.contains("*", this.subTypes);
201
202      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
203      sb.append(mediaType);
204      for (NameValuePair p : parameters)
205         sb.append(';').append(p.getName()).append('=').append(p.getValue());
206      this.string = sb.toString();
207   }
208
209   /**
210    * Returns the <js>'type'</js> fragment of the <js>'type/subType'</js> string.
211    *
212    * @return The media type.
213    */
214   public final String getType() {
215      return type;
216   }
217
218   /**
219    * Returns the <js>'subType'</js> fragment of the <js>'type/subType'</js> string.
220    *
221    * @return The media subtype.
222    */
223   public final String getSubType() {
224      return subType;
225   }
226
227   /**
228    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the subtype contains the specified <js>'+'</js> delimited subtype value.
229    *
230    * @param st
231    *    The subtype string.
232    *    Case is ignored.
233    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the subtype contains the specified subtype string.
234    */
235   public final boolean hasSubType(String st) {
236      if (st != null)
237         for (String s : subTypes)
238            if (st.equalsIgnoreCase(s))
239               return true;
240      return false;
241   }
242
243   /**
244    * Returns the subtypes broken down by fragments delimited by <js>"'"</js>.
245    *
246    * <P>
247    * For example, the media type <js>"text/foo+bar"</js> will return a list of
248    * <code>[<js>'foo'</js>,<js>'bar'</js>]</code>
249    *
250    * @return An unmodifiable list of subtype fragments.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
251    */
252   public final List<String> getSubTypes() {
253      return alist(subTypes);
254   }
255
256   /**
257    * Performs an action on the subtypes broken down by fragments delimited by <js>"'"</js>.
258    *
259    * @param action The action to perform.
260    * @return This object.
261    */
262   public final MediaType forEachSubType(Consumer<String> action) {
263      for (String s : subTypes)
264         action.accept(s);
265      return this;
266   }
267
268   /**
269    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this media type subtype contains the <js>'*'</js> meta character.
270    *
271    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this media type subtype contains the <js>'*'</js> meta character.
272    */
273   public final boolean isMetaSubtype() {
274      return hasSubtypeMeta;
275   }
276
277   /**
278    * Returns a match metric against the specified media type where a larger number represents a better match.
279    *
280    * <p>
281    * This media type can contain <js>'*'</js> metacharacters.
282    * <br>The comparison media type must not.
283    *
284    * <ul>
285    *    <li>Exact matches (e.g. <js>"text/json"</js>/</js>"text/json"</js>) should match
286    *       better than meta-character matches (e.g. <js>"text/*"</js>/</js>"text/json"</js>)
287    *    <li>The comparison media type can have additional subtype tokens (e.g. <js>"text/json+foo"</js>)
288    *       that will not prevent a match if the <c>allowExtraSubTypes</c> flag is set.
289    *       The reverse is not true, e.g. the comparison media type must contain all subtype tokens found in the
290    *       comparing media type.
291    *       <ul>
292    *          <li>We want the {@link JsonSerializer} (<js>"text/json"</js>) class to be able to handle requests for <js>"text/json+foo"</js>.
293    *          <li>We want to make sure {@link org.apache.juneau.json.Json5Serializer} (<js>"text/json5"</js>) does not handle
294    *             requests for <js>"text/json"</js>.
295    *       </ul>
296    *       More token matches should result in a higher match number.
297    * </ul>
298    *
299    * The formula is as follows for <c>type/subTypes</c>:
300    * <ul>
301    *    <li>An exact match is <c>100,000</c>.
302    *    <li>Add the following for type (assuming subtype match is &lt;0):
303    *    <ul>
304    *       <li><c>10,000</c> for an exact match (e.g. <js>"text"</js>==<js>"text"</js>).
305    *       <li><c>5,000</c> for a meta match (e.g. <js>"*"</js>==<js>"text"</js>).
306    *    </ul>
307    *    <li>Add the following for subtype (assuming type match is &lt;0):
308    *    <ul>
309    *       <li><c>7,500</c> for an exact match (e.g. <js>"json+foo"</js>==<js>"json+foo"</js> or <js>"json+foo"</js>==<js>"foo+json"</js>)
310    *       <li><c>100</c> for every subtype entry match (e.g. <js>"json"</js>/<js>"json+foo"</js>)
311    *    </ul>
312    * </ul>
313    *
314    * @param o The media type to compare with.
315    * @param allowExtraSubTypes If <jk>true</jk>,
316    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the media types match.
317    */
318   public final int match(MediaType o, boolean allowExtraSubTypes) {
319
320      if (o == null)
321         return -1;
322
323      // Perfect match
324      if (this == o || (type.equals(o.type) && subType.equals(o.subType)))
325         return 100000;
326
327      int c = 0;
328
329      if (type.equals(o.type))
330         c += 10000;
331      else if ("*".equals(type) || "*".equals(o.type))
332         c += 5000;
333
334      if (c == 0)
335         return 0;
336
337      // Subtypes match but are ordered different
338      if (ArrayUtils.equals(subTypesSorted, o.subTypesSorted))
339         return c + 7500;
340
341      for (String st1 : subTypes) {
342         if ("*".equals(st1))
343            c += 0;
344         else if (ArrayUtils.contains(st1, o.subTypes))
345            c += 100;
346         else if (o.hasSubtypeMeta)
347            c += 0;
348         else
349            return 0;
350      }
351      for (String st2 : o.subTypes) {
352         if ("*".equals(st2))
353            c += 0;
354         else if (ArrayUtils.contains(st2, subTypes))
355            c += 100;
356         else if (hasSubtypeMeta)
357            c += 0;
358         else if (! allowExtraSubTypes)
359            return 0;
360         else
361            c += 10;
362      }
363
364      return c;
365   }
366
367   /**
368    * Returns the additional parameters on this media type.
369    *
370    * <p>
371    * For example, given the media type string <js>"text/html;level=1"</js>, will return a map
372    * with the single entry <code>{level:[<js>'1'</js>]}</code>.
373    *
374    * @return The map of additional parameters, or an empty map if there are no parameters.
375    */
376   public List<NameValuePair> getParameters() {
377      return alist(parameters);
378   }
379
380   /**
381    * Performs an action on the additional parameters on this media type.
382    *
383    * @param action The action to perform.
384    * @return This object.
385    */
386   public MediaType forEachParameter(Consumer<NameValuePair> action) {
387      for (NameValuePair p : parameters)
388         action.accept(p);
389      return this;
390   }
391
392   /**
393    * Returns the additional parameter on this media type.
394    *
395    * @param name The additional parameter name.
396    * @return The parameter value, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
397    */
398   public String getParameter(String name) {
399      for (NameValuePair p : parameters)
400         if (eq(name, p.getName()))
401            return p.getValue();
402      return null;
403   }
404
405   /**
406    * Given a list of media types, returns the best match for this <c>Content-Type</c> header.
407    *
408    * <p>
409    * Note that fuzzy matching is allowed on the media types where the <c>Content-Types</c> header may
410    * contain additional subtype parts.
411    * <br>For example, given a <c>Content-Type</c> value of <js>"text/json+activity"</js>,
412    * the media type <js>"text/json"</js> will match if <js>"text/json+activity"</js> or <js>"text/activity+json"</js>
413    * isn't found.
414    * <br>The purpose for this is to allow parsers to match when artifacts such as <c>id</c> properties are
415    * present in the header.
416    *
417    * @param mediaTypes The media types to match against.
418    * @return The index into the array of the best match, or <c>-1</c> if no suitable matches could be found.
419    */
420   public int match(List<MediaType> mediaTypes) {
421      int matchQuant = 0, matchIndex = -1;
422
423      for (int i = 0; i < mediaTypes.size(); i++) {
424         MediaType mt = mediaTypes.get(i);
425         int matchQuant2 = mt.match(this, true);
426         if (matchQuant2 > matchQuant) {
427            matchQuant = matchQuant2;
428            matchIndex = i;
429         }
430      }
431      return matchIndex;
432   }
433
434   private static HeaderElement parse(String value) {
435      HeaderElement[] elements = BasicHeaderValueParser.parseElements(emptyIfNull(StringUtils.trim(value)), null);
436      return (elements.length > 0 ? elements[0] : new BasicHeaderElement("", ""));
437   }
438
439   @Override /* Object */
440   public String toString() {
441      return string;
442   }
443
444   @Override /* Object */
445   public int hashCode() {
446      return string.hashCode();
447   }
448
449   @Override /* Object */
450   public boolean equals(Object o) {
451      return (o instanceof MediaType) && eq(this, (MediaType)o, (x,y)->eq(x.string, y.string));
452   }
453
454   @Override
455   public final int compareTo(MediaType o) {
456      return toString().compareTo(o.toString());
457   }
458}
